snippet: Lawyers for Richard J. Combs, the former Eutawville, S.C., police chief, say he fired his weapon because his life was in jeopardy as he was fighting Bernard Bailey, an unarmed black man, in 2011.
abstract: Prosecutors rest case in murder trial of former Eutawville, SC, Police Chief Richard J Combs, suspect in 2011 fatal shooting of unarmed black man Bernard Bailey; defense says Combs's life was endangered when two men were fighting.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for Richard J. Combs, the former Eutawville, S.C., police chief, say he fired his weapon because his life was in jeopardy as he was fighting Bernard Bailey, an unarmed black man, in 2011.

headline.main: South Carolina: Former Police Chief’s Defense Begins
headline.print_headline: South Carolina: Former Police Chief’s Defense Begins
